intro: Ouratea hexasperma, commonly known as the six-ribbed ouratea, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its striking, palmate leaves with six prominent veins. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, often surrounded by modified leaves called bracts. Its bark and leaves have been used in traditional medicine for their purported healing properties. The plant thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland forests.
